This guidance is only relevant for Customers who have purchased the K3 Premium SLA option. For a comparison of the Standard and Premium SLAs, please see What are the differences between the Standard and Premium SLA? Support Organisation Overview K3’s Service Desk provides Support Services which K3 delivers from multiple locations using global industry standard ITIL® best practices. The Support Team management is ITIL® qualified and reports to the Director of Global Operations. At any one time, there is always one Support Manager responsible for managing major incidents, and dealing with any customer escalations. Support Team members have goals to achieve which include exceeding the targets set out in this document, and also provide high levels of customer satisfaction which is measured from customer feedback upon resolution. Tickets are responded to by K3’s Customer Support Team who will investigate and resolve Incidents, involving more than one person within the Customer Support Team if necessary. If a deeper level of technical expertise is required, Incidents will be escalated to the appropriate K3 team (e.g. software development or hardware team) and worked on as required to seek to bring about a timely resolution where an Incident is confirmed. Ticket Priorities and Definitions Ticket Classification A ticket is classified into three possible categories: Incident Something is not working as expected Service Request You need help or want us to deliver something Change Request You would like us to change configuration or the product This ensures that K3 and customers understand why a ticket’s been raised, and helps prioritise how they are dealt with. Impact and Urgency Tickets are assigned an Impact and Urgency which is used to calculate the priority. Impact is a measure of the effect of an Incident. Urgency is a measure of how long it will be until an Incident has a significant business impact. The definitions of Impact and Urgency are in the table below: Rating Impact Urgency Low Superficial and does not materially impact functionality. A solution can be scheduled for when is mutually convenient. Medium Impacts functionality, but continued system use is possible. Needs to be addressed soon to prevent any further deterioration. High Affects the majority of users and/or prevents use of an entire system. Requires immediate attention. Priority The following table defines the priority levels applied to all Tickets which is calculated from the Impact and Urgency. Tickets which are not Incidents (examples include an enquiry on how to do something, or an enhancement request) will be assigned a Priority according to their Urgency only i.e. a Priority of P3, P4, or P5 for Urgency of High, Medium, or Low respectively. The priority of an Incident may change throughout its duration. For example, a Priority 2 Incident may be upgraded to Priority 1 if an Incident affecting some users spreads to all users; or a Priority 1 Incident could be downgraded to Priority 2 if a Workaround is provided in advance of a permanent fix. Urgency Impact Low Medium High Low P5 P4 P3 Medium P4 P3 P2 High P3 P2 P1 The circumstances of an Incident determine its Impact or Urgency. An example is where a store has four Point of Sale (POS) solutions, and one develops a fault which renders it inoperable (hardware or software): During a quiet period when customer numbers are low, this might have an Impact of “Medium” and an Urgency of “Medium” (resulting in a Priority of “P3”). If the same Incident were to occur in a very busy period, the Impact would still be “Medium” (because other POS solutions are operable), but the Urgency may be “High” (resulting in a Priority of “P2”). In the extremely unlikely event that all POS solutions were inoperable in a location, this would be a High Impact and High Urgency Incident, resulting in a Priority of “P1”. Note that a “location” does not necessarily mean everything at a site/store – please see examples below: A P1 could be for a significant area such as a café is not able to trade, even if the shop in another building at the same site is able to trade. If online trading which K3 hosts is not functioning, but trading in a physical store is working, then the website is still a location that cannot trade i.e. a P1 situation. SLA Target Times The table below provides the target times for Incidents and Questions which are calculated during Business Days. The target times are generally twice as fast as the Standard SLA which means that Premium customers will effectively jump the queue compared to Standard SLA customers raising the same priority ticket at a similar time. Priority Target First Response Time Target Recovery Time Target Resolution Time P1 ½ hour 4 Hours 1 Business Day* P2 2 hours 2 Business Days 5 Business Days P3 4 hours 5 Business Days 4 Weeks P4 8 hours 1 Month 2 Months P5 16 hours Not Applicable 4 Months * If a solution is possible remotely; 1.5 business days if an onsite visit is required for a hardware breakdown. If applicable, the Support Team will endeavour to provide a Workaround which K3 may deem as a sufficient resolution that a permanent fix is not required. The scope of what is included in the Premium SLA target times is greater than the Standard SLA; the Standard SLA applies to Incidents only, but this Premium SLA also applies to Questions (How-To) up to a maximum of 15 minutes per ticket (after which training or further support effort will be chargeable). Note that the Target Recovery Time and the Target Resolution Time shall not apply to any Incident which is determined not to be a Product Fault or a Service Request - Question (How-To), and K3 reserves the right to charge the Customer for any time spent by K3’s Support Team investigating any non-product Faults (e.g. faults caused by the Customer or Customer’s infrastructure). The service levels listed above are targets only, and do not constitute a guaranteed service level. Any failure by K3 to meet these targets shall not, of itself, constitute a breach of contract or a default on the part of K3. Support Service Hours Standard Hours Standard Hours are weekdays, excluding Public Holidays in the Customer’s country, during the local hours of the K3 Service Desk as displayed on the k3btg.com Support web page (together defined as “Business Days”). Incidents will be worked on during Business Days and additionally, Customers may log Tickets 24x7 by emailing K3 Support or using the K3 Support Portal. Extended Hours Three Extended Hours options are available for additional fees for K3 to provide support for Priority 1 and 2 Incidents only as follows (either one or multiple options may be purchased): Weekday Evenings (excl. Public holidays) Saturdays Sundays and Public Holidays (excludes 25th December when we are closed) The hours included in each option vary by country as defined on the k3btg.com Support web page. Any purchased option will be deemed part of a “Business Day” (for the purposes of the Service Desk provision) for Priority 1 and 2 Incidents only. * Extended Hours options are not available for some legacy products, and hardware support is only offered on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays Accessing Support Services All Tickets must be investigated through the Customer’s internal support tiers prior to being referred to K3. Support Portal The Support Portal website address is https://support.k3btg.com. It is the best choice for Customers to access Support Services because it provides information which may solve the query automatically, and if not, it enables the Support Team to respond and help Customers more quickly due to the structured information about the Ticket which is captured via the Support Portal. In the unlikely event that a whole site is unable to trade (i.e. a Priority 1 Incident), then Customers can either phone the hotline, or raise a Ticket on the Support Portal. Any P1s raised by the portal are automatically notified to all support team members via an integration with K3’s internal chat platform (Microsoft Teams), so this method is just as fast as making a phone call, and may be the better method if you need to pass lots of information that is difficult to do over the phone (e.g. screenshots). Creating a Ticket via the Support Portal also facilitates efficient follow-up communications such as Support providing updates, and Customers providing further information if requested. Customers can self-register for the portal, and once we have performed verification checks, they will be able to see and do more than via email or phone (see You're here, but why use the portal?), and upon request, customers can see all tickets for their company as well as just their own. Support Hotline For Priority 1, 2, and 3 Incidents, and urgent Service Request - Questions, Premium SLA Customers may call the applicable local Support Hotline during Standard Hours (Priority 1 and 2 only during Extended Hours, if purchased). Lower priority Incidents, and non-Incidents (requests for help, change requests) must be registered via the Support Portal or email, not via the Hotline. Support may phone the Customer at a later point to explain something or discuss an issue if it’s likely to be the most efficient way to resolve an Incident. Type Contact Support Portal https://support.k3btg.com/ Support Email support@k3btg.com Danish & Swedish Support Hotline +45 7011 9100 Dutch Support Hotline +31 157 99 78 00 English Support Hotline (except for the below) +44 161 524 6793 English Support Hotline for SmartVision, Omnis, Sigma, JobBOSS +44 190 493 5732 German Support Hotline +49 7344 166 3100 Norwegian Support Hotline +47 3399 8150 Support Email The K3 Support email address is support@k3btg.com. Tickets raised by email default to a category of Service Request, and Priority 4, but once reviewed by a Support Team member, the Category, Impact, and Urgency will be updated in accordance with our understanding of the email content. Unlike tickets raised on the Support Portal which can be automatically prioritised and managed as applicable, this cannot happen automatically with tickets from email until they have been reviewed. Therefore, High Impact and Urgency Incidents should never be reported this way to avoid delays in the Incident being investigated. Ticket Communication Every Ticket raised will be assigned a unique reference number which is provided to the Customer on the Support Portal and via email to enable the Customer and K3 Support to follow up on Tickets efficiently where necessary. If the first contact from a Customer for a Priority 1 or Priority 2 Incident is via calling the Support Hotline, Support will register the details on the Support Portal to track details, notify the Customer of updates, and to maintain a full report of all Tickets raised by each Customer. Ticket updates, status, and target dates are available to view on the portal, and most updates are also emailed to the Customer. The Support Team may phone the Customer if it is determined to be the most efficient and effective way to provide an update or investigate an Incident further. K3’s Support Team will endeavour to communicate in the primary language of the Customer’s country, but to enable the maximum amount of K3’s expertise to be used to solve an Incident, K3’s Support Team may communicate in English even if the first contact was not in English. Service Management Quarterly Reviews Quarterly service reviews will be arranged with a K3 Support Manager and Customer Success Manager where the tickets raised in the previous period will be reviewed to assess where improvements may be made to the service, and where K3 might be able to help the customer to avoid similar issues in future. Bespoke reports will be made available to Customers in advance of the meeting which will provide a summary and detailed level of information, and can be tailored to the Customer’s needs. Escalation Process Priority 1 Incidents will be automatically escalated to a Support Manager who will ensure that all possible actions are taken to resolve it quickly. We are committed to delivering high quality support to all our Customers. In the unlikely event that a Customer has worked through K3’s support processes and is not satisfied with the service received, Customers can escalate the Support Ticket direct to a Support Manager via the portal, phone call, or email. Please provide the Ticket number and reason for the escalation. The escalation request will be evaluated by a Support Manager on a number of factors including the Ticket type and if the Ticket has not met any of the relevant target times in this SLA. Appendix: Definitions and Terms Please note the following terms and definitions that are used in this document. Term Definition Incident A type of Ticket which is a Product Fault causing an unplanned interruption to the Service or reduction in the quality of the Service. Product Fault Any error, bug, or defect with K3’s software, hardware, or hosting services (excluding any error, bug, or defect contained within any customer specific configuration or infrastructure). Support Services The provision by K3 of a remote support service to enable the Customer to report and K3 to investigate Product Faults in the applicable supported K3 product. Target Recovery Time The time from the Customer successfully registering an Incident with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support provides a Workaround which reduces the impact of an Incident. Target Resolution Time The time from the Customer successfully registering a Ticket with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support provides (i) a Workaround which K3 deems as a sufficient resolution that a permanent fix is not required, (ii) a permanent fix if no Workaround is possible, or if the Workaround cannot remain in place long-term. Target Response Time The time from the Customer successfully registering an Incident with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support first provides a (non-automated) response. Ticket A record of every request made by the Customer to K3 for Support Services. Workaround A temporary solution for an Incident to minimise the business impact while waiting for a permanent fix. As technology, products, and processes evolve, it may be necessary for K3 to amend, update, or supplement this guidance. This document may therefore be amended, updated, or supplemented from time to time by K3, at its discretion.

Introduction

This document provides additional information and guidance on the K3 Support Service.

 

This guidance is only relevant for Customers who have purchased the K3 Premium SLA option. For a comparison of the Standard and Premium SLAs, please see What are the differences between the Standard and Premium SLA?


Support Organisation Overview

K3’s Service Desk provides Support Services which K3 delivers from multiple locations using global industry standard ITIL® best practices. The Support Team management is ITIL® qualified and reports to the Director of Global Operations. At any one time, there is always one Support Manager responsible for managing major incidents, and dealing with any customer escalations.

 

Support Team members have goals to achieve which include exceeding the targets set out in this document, and also provide high levels of customer satisfaction which is measured from customer feedback upon resolution.

 

Tickets are responded to by K3’s Customer Support Team who will investigate and resolve Incidents, involving more than one person within the Customer Support Team if necessary. If a deeper level of technical expertise is required, Incidents will be escalated to the appropriate K3 team (e.g. software development or hardware team) and worked on as required to seek to bring about a timely resolution where an Incident is confirmed. 


Ticket Priorities and Definitions

Ticket Classification

A ticket is classified into three possible categories:

  1. Incident                          Something is not working as expected
  2. Service Request            You need help or want us to deliver something
  3. Change Request            You would like us to change configuration or the product

This ensures that K3 and customers understand why a ticket’s been raised, and helps prioritise how they are dealt with.


Impact and Urgency

Tickets are assigned an Impact and Urgency which is used to calculate the priority.

  • Impact is a measure of the effect of an Incident.
  • Urgency is a measure of how long it will be until an Incident has a significant business impact.

 

The definitions of Impact and Urgency are in the table below:

Priority

The following table defines the priority levels applied to all Tickets which is calculated from the Impact and Urgency. Tickets which are not Incidents (examples include an enquiry on how to do something, or an enhancement request) will be assigned a Priority according to their Urgency only i.e. a Priority of P3, P4, or P5 for Urgency of High, Medium, or Low respectively.

 

The priority of an Incident may change throughout its duration. For example, a Priority 2 Incident may be upgraded to Priority 1 if an Incident affecting some users spreads to all users; or a Priority 1 Incident could be downgraded to Priority 2 if a Workaround is provided in advance of a permanent fix.

The circumstances of an Incident determine its Impact or Urgency. An example is where a store has four Point of Sale (POS) solutions, and one develops a fault which renders it inoperable (hardware or software):

  • During a quiet period when customer numbers are low, this might have an Impact of “Medium” and an Urgency of “Medium” (resulting in a Priority of “P3”).
  • If the same Incident were to occur in a very busy period, the Impact would still be “Medium” (because other POS solutions are operable), but the Urgency may be “High” (resulting in a Priority of “P2”).

 

In the extremely unlikely event that all POS solutions were inoperable in a location, this would be a High Impact and High Urgency Incident, resulting in a Priority of “P1”. Note that a “location” does not necessarily mean everything at a site/store – please see examples below:

  • A P1 could be for a significant area such as a café is not able to trade, even if the shop in another building at the same site is able to trade.
  • If online trading which K3 hosts is not functioning, but trading in a physical store is working, then the website is still a location that cannot trade i.e. a P1 situation.

 

SLA Target Times

The table below provides the target times for Incidents and Questions which are calculated during Business Days. The target times are generally twice as fast as the Standard SLA which means that Premium customers will effectively jump the queue compared to Standard SLA customers raising the same priority ticket at a similar time.

If applicable, the Support Team will endeavour to provide a Workaround which K3 may deem as a sufficient resolution that a permanent fix is not required.

 

The scope of what is included in the Premium SLA target times is greater than the Standard SLA; the Standard SLA applies to Incidents only, but this Premium SLA also applies to Questions (How-To) up to a maximum of 15 minutes per ticket (after which training or further support effort will be chargeable).

 

Note that the Target Recovery Time and the Target Resolution Time shall not apply to any Incident which is determined not to be a Product Fault or a Service Request - Question (How-To), and K3 reserves the right to charge the Customer for any time spent by K3’s Support Team investigating any non-product Faults (e.g. faults caused by the Customer or Customer’s infrastructure).

 

The service levels listed above are targets only, and do not constitute a guaranteed service level. Any failure by K3 to meet these targets shall not, of itself, constitute a breach of contract or a default on the part of K3.


Support Service Hours

Standard Hours

Standard Hours are weekdays, excluding Public Holidays in the Customer’s country, during the local hours of the K3 Service Desk as displayed on the k3btg.com Support web page (together defined as “Business Days”). Incidents will be worked on during Business Days and additionally, Customers may log Tickets 24x7 by emailing K3 Support or using the K3 Support Portal.

 

Extended Hours

Three Extended Hours options are available for additional fees for K3 to provide support for Priority 1 and 2 Incidents only as follows (either one or multiple options may be purchased):

 

  1. Weekday Evenings (excl. Public holidays)
  2. Saturdays
  3. Sundays and Public Holidays (excludes 25th December when we are closed)

 

The hours included in each option vary by country as defined on the k3btg.com Support web page. Any purchased option will be deemed part of a “Business Day” (for the purposes of the Service Desk provision) for Priority 1 and 2 Incidents only.


* Extended Hours options are not available for some legacy products, and hardware support is only offered on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays


Accessing Support Services

All Tickets must be investigated through the Customer’s internal support tiers prior to being referred to K3.

 

Support Portal

The Support Portal website address is https://support.k3btg.com. It is the best choice for Customers to access Support Services because it provides information which may solve the query automatically, and if not, it enables the Support Team to respond and help Customers more quickly due to the structured information about the Ticket which is captured via the Support Portal. In the unlikely event that a whole site is unable to trade (i.e. a Priority 1 Incident), then Customers can either phone the hotline, or raise a Ticket on the Support Portal.

 

Any P1s raised by the portal are automatically notified to all support team members via an integration with K3’s internal chat platform (Microsoft Teams), so this method is just as fast as making a phone call, and may be the better method if you need to pass lots of information that is difficult to do over the phone (e.g. screenshots).

 

Creating a Ticket via the Support Portal also facilitates efficient follow-up communications such as Support providing updates, and Customers providing further information if requested. Customers  can self-register for the portal, and once we have performed verification checks, they will be able to see and do more than via email or phone (see You're here, but why use the portal?), and upon request, customers can see all tickets for their company as well as just their own.

 

Support Hotline

For Priority 1, 2, and 3 Incidents, and urgent Service Request - Questions, Premium SLA Customers may call the applicable local Support Hotline during Standard Hours (Priority 1 and 2 only during Extended Hours, if purchased). Lower priority Incidents, and non-Incidents (requests for help, change requests) must be registered via the Support Portal or email, not via the Hotline. Support may phone the Customer at a later point to explain something or discuss an issue if it’s likely to be the most efficient way to resolve an Incident.

Support Email

The K3 Support email address is support@k3btg.com. Tickets raised by email default to a category of Service Request, and Priority 4, but once reviewed by a Support Team member, the Category, Impact, and Urgency will be updated in accordance with our understanding of the email content.

 

Unlike tickets raised on the Support Portal which can be automatically prioritised and managed as applicable, this cannot happen automatically with tickets from email until they have been reviewed. Therefore, High Impact and Urgency Incidents should never be reported this way to avoid delays in the Incident being investigated.


Ticket Communication

Every Ticket raised will be assigned a unique reference number which is provided to the Customer on the Support Portal and via email to enable the Customer and K3 Support to follow up on Tickets efficiently where necessary. If the first contact from a Customer for a Priority 1 or Priority 2 Incident is via calling the Support Hotline, Support will register the details on the Support Portal to track details, notify the Customer of updates, and to maintain a full report of all Tickets raised by each Customer. 

 

Ticket updates, status, and target dates are available to view on the portal, and most updates are also emailed to the Customer. The Support Team may phone the Customer if it is determined to be the most efficient and effective way to provide an update or investigate an Incident further.

 

K3’s Support Team will endeavour to communicate in the primary language of the Customer’s country, but to enable the maximum amount of K3’s expertise to be used to solve an Incident, K3’s Support Team may communicate in English even if the first contact was not in English.



Service Management

Quarterly Reviews

Quarterly service reviews will be arranged with a K3 Support Manager and Customer Success Manager where the tickets raised in the previous period will be reviewed to assess where improvements may be made to the service, and where K3 might be able to help the customer to avoid similar issues in future. 

 

Bespoke reports will be made available to Customers in advance of the meeting which will provide a summary and detailed level of information, and can be tailored to the Customer’s needs.

 

Escalation Process

Priority 1 Incidents will be automatically escalated to a Support Manager who will ensure that all possible actions are taken to resolve it quickly. 

 

We are committed to delivering high quality support to all our Customers. In the unlikely event that a Customer has worked through K3’s support processes and is not satisfied with the service received, Customers can escalate the Support Ticket direct to a Support Manager via the portal, phone call, or email.

 

Please provide the Ticket number and reason for the escalation. The escalation request will be evaluated by a Support Manager on a number of factors including the Ticket type and if the Ticket has not met any of the relevant target times in this SLA.


Appendix: Definitions and Terms

Please note the following terms and definitions that are used in this document. 

Term

Definition

Incident

A type of Ticket which is a Product Fault causing an unplanned interruption to the Service or reduction in the quality of the Service.

Product Fault

Any error, bug, or defect with K3’s software, hardware, or hosting services (excluding any error, bug, or defect contained within any customer specific configuration or infrastructure).

Support Services

The provision by K3 of a remote support service to enable the Customer to report and K3 to investigate Product Faults in the applicable supported K3 product.

Target Recovery Time

The time from the Customer successfully registering an Incident with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support provides a Workaround which reduces the impact of an Incident.

Target Resolution Time

The time from the Customer successfully registering a Ticket with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support provides (i) a Workaround which K3 deems as a sufficient resolution that a permanent fix is not required, (ii) a permanent fix if no Workaround is possible, or if the Workaround cannot remain in place long-term.

Target Response Time

The time from the Customer successfully registering an Incident with K3 Support to the time that K3 Support first provides a (non-automated) response.

Ticket

A record of every request made by the Customer to K3 for Support Services.

Workaround

A temporary solution for an Incident to minimise the business impact while waiting for a permanent fix.

2 Only available via the Portal.


 

Peak Period or Annual Subscription

K3 understands that different businesses have different peak periods and may not require Premium SLA benefits the whole year round. Premium can be purchased in blocks of three months for when it’s required to fit your commercial needs, or a discounted annual subscription option is also available.

How Can I Compare SLAs in Detail?

Both SLAs can be seen in detail from the links listed below. You can also review What are the differences between the Standard and Premium SLA?

  • Standard Service Level Agreement (SLA)
  • Premium Service Level Agreement (SLA)

text: W E L C O M E to the K 3 S U P P O R T P O R T A L We're glad you're here :-) but just in case you're not sure, the portal is the best way to log and review all of your tickets because.... Your ticket will be dealt with faster! > You can let us know instantly what the category, urgency and impact of your request is. Any P1s logged via the portal (P1 means that you can't trade at all from a physical or online location) are immediately alerted to all support team members. > Tickets from email default to low priority; they have to wait for an agent to read, categorise, and assess their view of the impact and urgency. Use the portal for urgent issues. ?? Phone calls are quicker aren't they ?? Phone us only when something is stopping you trading i.e. is high impact and urgency = P1. If you phone for lower priority things, you may be blocking people who have a genuine emergency. The portal can suggest solutions from our knowledge base for speedier resolution to common questions and issues. See the latest updates on one or all tickets all in one place. > We can also enable access to see all tickets for your whole company, not just your own tickets (raise a Service Request/Access Request ticket for this). You can see what to expect from Support (when logged into the portal) including the Service Level Agreement (SLA). Check if a ticket is being worked on by K3, or if it's waiting for you, the customer to respond. Some information can only be seen on the portal (it can't be sent via email). You can see if we met the First Response SLA, what the Target Resolution Date is, and for resolved tickets, you can look at the Resolution Summary, and if we met the Target Resolution SLA. See what can you see on the portal? (when logged into the portal) for more information Some product documentation is integrated which will be suggested to you if relevant. Release notes for some products are available. The portal content and functionality is only available once you are logged in. When logged in, the portal knows what product(s) your company has purchased from us, so you will only see relevant content If you haven't already, please register to use the portal (see How to register to use the portal)

description:
W E L C O M E  to the K 3 
S U P P O R T  P O R T A L 



We're glad you're here :-) but just in case you're not sure, the portal is the best way to log and review all of your tickets because....


  1. Your ticket will be dealt with faster! 

    > You can let us know instantly what the category, urgency and impact of your request is. Any P1s logged via the portal (P1 means that you can't trade at all from a physical or online location) are immediately alerted to all support team members.

    > Tickets from email default to low priority; they have to wait for an agent to read, categorise, and assess their view of the impact and urgency. Use the portal for urgent issues.

    ?? Phone calls are quicker aren't they ?? Phone us only when something is stopping you trading i.e. is high impact and urgency = P1. If you phone for lower priority things, you may be blocking people who have a genuine emergency.
     
  2. The portal can suggest solutions from our knowledge base for speedier resolution to common questions and issues.

  3. See the latest updates on one or all tickets all in one place.

    > We can also enable access to see all tickets for your whole company, not just your own tickets (raise a Service Request/Access Request ticket for this).

  4. You can see what to expect from Support (when logged into the portal) including the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

  5. Check if a ticket is being worked on by K3, or if it's waiting for you, the customer to respond.

  6. Some information can only be seen on the portal (it can't be sent via email). You can see if we met the First Response SLA, what the Target Resolution Date is, and for resolved tickets, you can look at the Resolution Summary, and if we met the Target Resolution SLA. See what can you see on the portal? (when logged into the portal) for more information

  7. Some product documentation is integrated which will be suggested to you if relevant.

  8. Release notes for some products are available.


The portal content and functionality is only available once you are logged in. 
When logged in, the portal knows what product(s) your company has purchased from us, so you will only see relevant content



If you haven't already, please register to use the portal (see How to register to use the portal)

Who Is This Portal For?

This portal is for customers of K3 Business Technologies who have an active subscription or support contract for one of the following products:

Cowis
DdD
Imagine
JobBOSS
LSOne
MStore
Omnis
Retail Manager
RMS
RVE
Sigma
SmartVision
Hardware support only (Product Name is "OTHER")



How to Register / Sign Up

For initial registration, please click on the Signup link and enter your full name and email address (screenshot below). Please use your business address so that we can identify which company you work for.



The sign up page looks like the below (where we have filled in an example).


You will then see a confirmation banner above the login page (see green banner in screenshot below).

There's nothing more for you to do until we have sent you an activation email - see the next section.



Please note that  your email address must not be registered already. If we already have your email address in our system, you will see an error like the below. If this happens, then you may need to reset your password - please see How to reset your password



Activate Your Account

Once you have registered, we will review your request, match you with your company record in our system, and send an activation email which will ask you to set a password. Screenshots of this process are below:


1. Activation Email Example

2. Password Setting Screen (from clicking the link in the email)


3. Successful Account Activation

Once you have entered your password and clicked on the "Activate and Log in" button, you will be logged in with the confirmation message shown in the green banner below



Once you are logged in, you will be able to see more information on how to use this portal, submit tickets, see all of your tickets (and your colleagues as well if you ask us to enable  you to see them), and search our knowledge base for answers to any queries you may have

Password Reset Email

description:
Portal

This is the best way of contacting Support, and the reasons why can be found in You're here, but why use the portal?


You will need to register to use the portal.  If you haven't registered already, please see How to register to use the portal 


Email

You can email support@k3btg.com but as the You're here, but why use the portal article explains , tickets created from emailing us is the slowest way of engaging Support to work on a request or issue you have, so do not use email for high impact and high urgency issues.


Emails for follow-up on existing tickets are fine, regardless of the ticket category and priority.


Phone Hotlines

The support hotline is only for serious issues which prevent trading/operations.

This keeps the phone lines free for emergencies only, so that if your business can't function, you are not waiting on the phone line while someone else is talking to Support about something less critical. 


To call support in an emergency (Priority 1 Incident) to report a new issue, please use the relevant number for your country below. Note that Premium SLA customers are also entitled to phone for Priority 2 Incidents.


If our phone lines are busy, then please wait until you get through, or choose the option to leave a voicemail which you will be given if you have waited more than 5 minutes.

If you log a P1 ticket via the Support Portal, then we will be alerted immediately, so this method is as effective as phoning the hotline, and may even be more effective if you need to provide screenshots or other information which we might ask you for on a phone call.


 

Country

Phone Number

Danish Support Hotline

+45 70 11 91 00

Dutch Support Hotline

+31 157 99 78 00

English Support Hotline (except the products below)

+44 161 524 6793

English Support Hotline for SmartVision, Omnis, Sigma, JobBOSS

+44 190 493 5732

German Support Hotline

+49 7344 166 31 00

Norwegian Support Hotline

+47 3399 8150

Sweden Support Hotline

+45 70 11 91 00



If we need to talk to you about an existing ticket, we will arrange (via updates on the ticket) to call you at an agreed time. Please don't call us so that we keep the hotline free for new emergencies


Also See

  • What days and times is Support available? 

  • Standard Service Level Agreement (SLA) (must be logged into the customer portal to see this)

  • What are the differences between the Standard and Premium SLA?

Standard Hours

We have support teams based in different countries who operate different standard hours in line with the majority of customer's standard open hours in that region.


The Nordics

Monday to Friday 8:30am to 4:30pm


United Kingdom

Monday to Friday 9:00am to 5:30pm except the below products:

SmartVision, Omnis, Sigma, JobBOSS are supported Monday-Friday 9:00am to 5:00pm


The Netherlands

Monday to Friday 8:30am to 6:30pm


Germany

Monday to Friday 8:00am to 6:00pm


Public Holidays on week days in the above regions are excluded; Extended Hours option 3 below is required to respond to customers on Public Holidays.



Extended Hours

Extended Hours are for customers who have subscribed to the extra support times and are for Priority 1 Incidents only (i.e. something which is preventing you from trading).  Premium Service Level Agreement (SLA) customers can also contact Support for Priority 2 Incidents (e.g. something that is seriously restricting your ability to trade such as 1 POS not working, but 2 POS are working).


Extended Hours are not available for some products (as noted below).

You can register lower priority issues outside of our Standard Hours via the portal or email, but they will not be worked on during Extended Hours.


Three Extended Hours options are available for additional fees to provide support for Priority 1 Incidents only as follows (either one or multiple options may be purchased):

 

  1. Weekday Evenings (excl. Public holidays)
  2. Saturdays
  3. Sundays and Public Holidays (excludes 25th December when we are closed, and some other exceptions)


Please contact your K3 Customer Success Manager if you would like to purchase any of these options, or check if you have them already.


The Nordics

  1. Weekday Evenings: 4:30pm to 7:00pm
  2. Saturdays: 10:00am to 6:00pm
  3. Sundays: 10:00am to 5:00pm and Public Holidays: 10:00am to 2:00pm


United Kingdom

  1. Weekday Evenings: 5:30pm to 8:00pm
  2. Saturdays: 9:00am to 5:30pm
  3. Sundays and Public Holidays: 9:00am to 5:30pm


No extended hours options for SmartVision, Omnis, Sigma, or JobBOSS, and hardware support is offered on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays only.


The Netherlands

  1. Thursday and Friday Evenings: 6:30pm to 9:30pm
  2. Saturdays: 8:30am to 5:30pm
  3. Sundays (no Public Holiday cover unless exceptionally agreed): 12:00pm to 5:30pm

 

Germany

No extended hours for Cowis.

Imagine and DdD/RIAB have extended hours options which match The Nordics open hours.



Holiday Period Exceptions

Support is available on Public Holidays in the relevant country using Sunday open hours. There are some exceptions around major holidays such as Christmas and Easter which will be listed below if relevant.


Also See

  • How do I contact Support?

  • Standard Service Level Agreement (SLA) (login to portal to see this)

  • What are the differences between the Standard and Premium SLA? (login to portal to see this)

title: What can you see on the portal?
category: How to use this portal and what to expect from Support
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Solutions
  • All of the tickets you have personally logged
  • Ticket Information that is not available via emails
  • Tickets that anyone in your company has logged
  • Export a list of tickets


Solutions

You can browse and search our Knowledge Base - see How to search the Knowledge Base to see if we already know the answer to your enquiry 


All of the tickets you have personally logged

You can also see all of the tickets you've logged with us by clicking on the Tickets menu item.


Note the panel on the right of the ticket list which lets you select if you want to see Open tickets, or Resolved, or All tickets


Note that when you click on a ticket from the list (if there are more than one), the top of the screen will show you the original description of the ticket, and below will then be all of the subsequent updates - you can choose to see the oldest or newest at the top by clicking on the option as shown below.



When you click on a ticket, the top of the screen will show you the original description of the ticket, and below will be all of the subsequent updates - you can choose to see the oldest or newest update at the top by clicking on the option as shown below.


Ticket Information that is not available via emails

Some information can only be seen on the portal (it can't be sent via email). You can:

  • Check if we met the First Response SLA (Service Level Agreement)
  • View the Target Resolution Date (this will show as being on pause if we are waiting for a customer response)
  • See if we met the Resolution SLA (for closed tickets)
  • Resolution Summary (text entered by the support agent)
  • For Premium SLA customers, you can now escalate a ticket direct from the portal


Tickets that anyone in your company has logged



Did you know that you can opt to see all tickets for your company as well as just your own tickets.

Raise a Service Request/Access Request to ask Support to enable this for you. 

   








Once enabled, you will be able to select to see your own tickets only, all of those for your company, or select to see tickets raised by any other individual in your company



Export a list of tickets

On the tickets screen, there is a button to Export Tickets. The screen which pops up will allow you to select which fields are exported, and if you want a CSV or an Excel format file.


Note that the default time period is tickets raised in the last 30 days - you can change this to a different preset, or select to set a custom date (which means that you can set the date from to an early date if you would like a list of all open tickets, regardless of when they were logged)

title: Clearing Entity Locks and Update Flags
description:
In the first instance ask all users to exit the Omnis system.


Log in to Omnis as the SUPER user.


Run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Display ALL Update Flags



If any of the options have users displayed in the Status run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Clear ALL Update Flags and enter Y to Clear:-



Select Yes to Save this data?


While users are out of the system run Clear ALL Report Files



Run Start>Micross Omnis>System Activity Display:-



If this is not available it needs to be installed. See Separate Knowledgebase Article.


Run the Omnis System Activity software:-


If this Displays and Entity or File Locks run Action>Delete All Locks:-



If you are unable to install the Omnis System Activity, you can clear the entity locks by navigating to the Omnis Control directory and deleting the MILOCK.DAT file. Omnis will create a new one when logging into Omnis.

text: Display Batch File Status An explanation of each field displayed is given below. Field Contents File The batch file number. Recs The total number of records on the file. This number is only set back to zero once all the records in the batch file have been successfully processed. Recs Used The number of records already processed. Update Flag This is set to Y if records are being entered onto the file from another terminal or it is being used to update the Sales Order file. It is set to N if it is not in use. Status The status of the file falls in the range 0 to 6. This field can have a number of settings which determine the status as follows: New file No records yet entered. Status 0. New orders entered Order records entered. Status 1. Orders ready for update Order records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing. Status 2 Amendments entered Amendment records entered. Status 3. Amendments ready for update Amendment records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing. Status 4. Credits entered Credit records have been entered. Status 5. Credits ready for update Credit records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing. Status 6. Note Orders can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 1. Orders can only be amended on a file with a status of 1. Orders can only be deleted on a file with a status of 1. Orders can only be posted from a file with a status of 2. Amendments can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 3. Amendments can only be amended on a file with a status of 3. Amendments can only be deleted on a file with a status of 3. Amendments can only be posted from a file with a status of 4. Credits can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 5. Credits can only be amended on a file with a status of 5. Credits can only be deleted on a file with a status of 5. Credits can only be posted from a file with a status of 6.
title: Display Batch File Status
description:
Display Batch File Status


An explanation of each field displayed is given below.


Field

Contents

File

The batch file number.

Recs

The total number of records on the file. This number is only set back to zero once all the records in the batch file have been successfully processed.

Recs Used

The number of records already processed.

Update Flag

This is set to Y if records are being entered onto the file from another terminal or it is being used to update the Sales Order file. It is set to N if it is not in use.

Status

The status of the file falls in the range 0 to 6. This field can have a number of settings which determine the status as follows:

 

New file

No records yet entered.

Status 0.

New orders entered

Order records entered.

Status 1.

Orders ready for update

Order records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing.

Status 2

 

Amendments entered

Amendment records entered.

Status 3.

 

Amendments ready for update

Amendment records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing.

Status 4.

 

Credits entered

Credit records have been entered.

Status 5.

 

Credits ready for update

Credit records have been entered and the file has been cleared for processing.

Status 6.

  • Note
  • Orders can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 1.
  • Orders can only be amended on a file with a status of 1.
  • Orders can only be deleted on a file with a status of 1.
  • Orders can only be posted from a file with a status of 2.
  • Amendments can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 3.
  • Amendments can only be amended on a file with a status of 3.
  • Amendments can only be deleted on a file with a status of 3.
  • Amendments can only be posted from a file with a status of 4.
  • Credits can be inserted on a file with a status of 0 or 5.
  • Credits can only be amended on a file with a status of 5.
  • Credits can only be deleted on a file with a status of 5.
  • Credits can only be posted from a file with a status of 6.

text: When you want to change the file retention in Omnis, you can do the following: First check the setup Open Materials - Stock Control - System Parameters Here you can see after how many periods the file retention will reset. Click on System Parameters again and this time choose Amend. If it will not allow you to amend because there are users logged in, please ask the users to log out. If it still insists that there are users logged in, you will have to clear the CSC Update Flags. Choose Superviser Functions - Clear CSC Update Flags and click Yes. Once the users are logged out, return to System Parameters and click Amend again. Click Enter until you reach Stock Period End Retention Count and change it to the desired number. Press Enter until you reach the end of the options and click Ok to save .
title: Changing file retention in Omnis
description:
When you want to change the file retention in Omnis, you can do the following:


First check the setup


Open Materials - Stock Control - System Parameters


Here you can see after how many periods the file retention will reset.



Click on System Parameters again and this time choose Amend.



If it will not allow you to amend because there are users logged in, please ask the users to log out. If it still insists that there are users logged in, you will have to clear the CSC Update Flags.


Choose Superviser Functions - Clear CSC Update Flags and click Yes.




Once the users are logged out, return to System Parameters and click Amend again.



Click Enter until you reach Stock Period End Retention Count and change it to the desired number.



Press Enter until you reach the end of the options and click Ok to save .

text: Omnis Hardware and Software Requirements The following hardware and software recommendations are made by K3 based on the experience of our customers and the operating system author’s recommendations. These requirements are effective as of September 2024 and are subject to change without notice. Minimum Hardware and Software Requirements Server Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed Single Core 2ghz Dual Core 2ghz or greater Memory 1GB 2GB or greater Hard Disk (Free Space) SATA 7200rpm RAID-5 (SAS) Network Adapter 100 Base-T 1000 Base-T Important Notes Tape Backup and UPS (battery backup) highly recommended Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Hardware specifications are based on a dedicated server and 20 concurrent users, if the server has additional workloads placed upon it, they should be factored into these recommendations. Server Software Supported Server Operating Systems Windows 2022 server Windows 2019 server Windows 2016 server Important Notes We do not recommend Windows Small Business Server, for sites larger than 20 concurrent Omnis users. However please discuss with support if this is a requirement. Client Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed 1GHz 2 GHz+ RAM 512MB 1GB+ Hard Disk (Free Space) 5GB 10GB Network Adaptor 100 Base-T 1000 Base-T Display Settings SVGA (1024x768) SVGA (1024 x 768 or greater) Other Hardware Requirements Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Isolated power circuits with surge protection or UPS recommended. Client Software Supported Client Operating Systems Windows 10 Professional or Enterprise Windows 11 Professional or Enterprise Note: To use 64bit Windows clients you will require the appropriate option. Contact your account manager for details. Other Required Software Internet Explorer version 6.x or above.

text: Your Point of Sale might be slow because it's old (5 years is the normal expected lifespan of any computer before operating system updates etc slow it down). The operating system might need optimising - see help in the product-specific sections of this knowledgebase. Some customers install other software on their POS, including back office software, Microsoft Office, and many other applications. This can slow your POS down if the hardware was specified for only running a POS (most likely) i.e. it was not intended as a general purpose computer. K3 test the performance and functionality of their POS software on the hardware that we supply, but we do not test the impact of adding many unknown extra applications on it. We can help you by supplying a higher specification POS if you do need a POS which doubles as a general purpose machine. Also See What Hardware Can I Purchase from K3? How Long Can Hardware be Supported For?
title: Why is my POS  / Till slow?
description:
Your Point of Sale might be slow because it's old (5 years is the normal expected lifespan of any computer before operating system updates etc slow it down). The operating system might need optimising - see help in the product-specific sections of this knowledgebase.

This can slow your POS down if the hardware was specified for only running a POS (most likely) i.e. it was not intended as a general purpose computer. K3 test the performance and functionality of their POS software on the hardware that we supply, but we do not test the impact of adding many unknown extra applications on it. text: TABLE OF CONTENTS K3-Supplied Hardware in Year 1 If you have a K3 Hardware Support Contract If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware) Post Year 1 Support (Hardware Support Contract Required) K3 Supplied Hardware Non-K3 Supplied Hardware When and How Will K3 Respond to Faults? Service Level Agreement Support Process What’s Not Covered K3-Supplied Hardware in Year 1 If you have a K3 Hardware Support Contract During the first year after K3 have supplied your POS/till, the full system is covered which includes: All-in-one POS units or PC based units Receipt printers Barcode scanners Cash drawers Monitors (if sold with PC base unit) Optional Add-ons you may have purchased: Ticket printers Label printers Tablets Standalone monitors/screens Hand Held Terminals (HHT’s) K3 Supplied Integrated Payment Terminals (purchased with an additional EFT package) Cover is for: Hardware Failures - Malfunctioning or failed items supplied by K3. Diagnosis and repair - Faults that occur through normal usage of the equipment. POS OS - POS Windows operating system issues which cause the POS to cease working. Associated Cable or PSU Failures - Issues with power supply units (PSUs) or data cables originally supplied with covered items. Remote or On-Site Attendance as required for repair or replacement of faulty hardware. Depending on the criticality, we may ask you to ship items to us for repair. If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware) If you do not have a K3 hardware support contract, you will be covered under the manufacturer's warranty only. Items will be handled via the suppliers standard RTB (return to base) warranty policy which K3 will facilitate. Note that our assistance will not be governed by a Service Level Agreement. Any shipping or initial inspection costs incurred by K3 will be passed on to the customer. The manufacturer's warranty may be longer than one year, but if you do not have a support contract with us, you will need to work with the manufacturer direct (or ask for us to quote to help you). Post Year 1 Support (Hardware Support Contract Required) K3 Supplied Hardware For K3-supplied hardware, customers can opt to purchase an annual hardware support contract (if they haven't already from the date we supplied the hardware). If a spare part is required for a repair, and it's for standard hardware which K3 supplied, the cost of the spare part is included in the annual hardware support. We generally hold them in stock for quick remediation which includes new and refurbished parts. In the unlikely event that a whole replacement POS unit or other sealed unit such as a tablet is required (not just a spare part), then this would not be included free of charge (unless the manufacturer's warranty provides for a free new complete unit). Note that if K3 supplied the hardware which is now more than a year old, but you do not have a hardware support contract with K3, then we may be able to help you, but it would not be governed by any SLA target times, and all time and materials would be chargeable at the standard rates. Non-K3 Supplied Hardware We can provide hardware support via a contract for customers who did not purchase their hardware from us. We will carry out a hardware audit before quoting and taking on support which will include recommendations, and terms bespoke for each customer. We will not purchase spares for your own hardware, but you may purchase spares which we will hold in stock, ready for any emergency repairs. Also See - How Long Can Hardware be Supported For? - Need Help, but Don't have a Hardware Support Contract? When and How Will K3 Respond to Faults? The following only applies to customers who have a hardware support contract in place. Service Level Agreement Customers with an annual hardware support contract will benefit from the target times as explained in the Standard Service Level Agreement (SLA). This SLA applies to the hardware and any faults with K3 software which you may be subscribing to. We will fix things remotely if possible, but if required to attend a site, we pride ourselves on usually being able to attend either the same, or next business day (depending on location and time of the fault being raised to us). Standard Hours of coverage are weekdays (excluding UK Public Holidays) by default, but there are options to purchase weekend and Public Holiday cover as well, as explained in What days and times is Support available? In addition, there is an option for having a Premium Service Level Agreement (SLA) - see What are the Benefits of the Premium SLA? for more information. Support Process We have multiple channels for you to gain access to support - see How do I contact K3 Retail Support? Once a support ticket is identified as a hardware-related issue, our first line support team will pass it to the hardware support team. Once the hardware technician confirms that the customer and hardware is eligible for hardware support, the technician will performs an initial diagnosis of the problem through a phone call or remote session. Basic checks include: POS units - Is there power to the unit? Can it reboot? Are any error messages displayed on the screen? Receipt printers - Can it print a self-test with legible text? Barcode scanners - Can it scan a barcode in Notepad? Cash drawers - Does it open correctly? If necessary, the technician will arrange an on-site visit at a mutually convenient time to investigate and rectify the issue. For issues which don't require a specialist engineer on site, we may ship replacement items to you and provide you with instructions and remote assistance to install them. What’s Not Covered Regardless of how old the hardware is, the following are not included in the hardware purchase price or support fees: Deliberate or Accidental Damage - Hardware damage caused intentionally or due to mishandling or accidents. This includes cosmetic damage which is not covered. Environmental Changes - Damage resulting from environmental factors such as water, heat, electrical, or other external conditions outside of our control. 3rd Party Changes - Any modifications, non-approved software installations, changes to the operating system or amendments by the customer, third-party services or vendors. 3rd Party Software - Any software not owned by K3 (e.g. the Windows operating system, antivirus), and updates to 3rd party software. Item Relocation - Moving or relocating hardware to a different location without consulting with K3 or K3's involvement. Consumables like printer toner, print heads, accessories, parts intended by the equipment manufacturer to require periodic replacement. Additional Hardware – Hardware not supplied by K3, or if you are using your own hardware, if it was not in the support contract audit. Data Restoration - if data is lost as a result of a hardware failure (e.g. a hard drive), we will rebuild the software, but cannot recover the software's data. If you have a backup and need help restoring it, we may be able to assist (time would be chargeable) Items Beyond Economic Repair - Any hardware where the cost of the required part(s) to make the hardware properly functional will exceed the current list or new replacement price, and/or any required spare parts or components are no longer available from the manufacturer.
title: Hardware Support - What's Covered?
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • K3-Supplied Hardware in Year 1
    • If you have a K3 Hardware Support Contract
    • If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware)
  • Post Year 1 Support (Hardware Support Contract Required)
    • K3 Supplied Hardware
    • Non-K3 Supplied Hardware
  • When and How Will K3 Respond to Faults?
    • Service Level Agreement
    • Support Process
  • What’s Not Covered


K3-Supplied Hardware in Year 1

If you have a K3 Hardware Support Contract

During the first year after K3 have supplied your POS/till, the full system is covered which includes:

  • All-in-one POS units or PC based units
  • Receipt printers
  • Barcode scanners
  • Cash drawers
  • Monitors (if sold with PC base unit)

 

Optional Add-ons you may have purchased:

  • Ticket printers
  • Label printers
  • Tablets
  • Standalone monitors/screens
  • Hand Held Terminals (HHT’s)
  • K3 Supplied Integrated Payment Terminals (purchased with an additional EFT package)

 

Cover is for:

  • Hardware Failures - Malfunctioning or failed items supplied by K3.
  • Diagnosis and repair - Faults that occur through normal usage of the equipment.
  • POS OS - POS Windows operating system issues which cause the POS to cease working.
  • Associated Cable or PSU Failures - Issues with power supply units (PSUs) or data cables originally supplied with covered items.


Remote or On-Site Attendance as required for repair or replacement of faulty hardware. Depending on the criticality, we may ask you to ship items to us for repair.



If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware)

If you do not have a K3 hardware support contract, you will be covered under the manufacturer's warranty only. Items will be handled via the suppliers standard RTB (return to base) warranty policy which K3 will facilitate. Note that our assistance will not be governed by a Service Level Agreement.


Any shipping or initial inspection costs incurred by K3 will be passed on to the customer.


The manufacturer's warranty may be longer than one year, but if you do not have a support contract with us, you will need to work with the manufacturer direct (or ask for us to quote to help you).


Post Year 1 Support (Hardware Support Contract Required)

K3 Supplied Hardware

For K3-supplied hardware, customers can opt to purchase an annual hardware support contract (if they haven't already from the date we supplied the hardware).


If a spare part is required for a repair, and it's for standard hardware which K3 supplied, the cost of the spare part is included in the annual hardware support. We generally hold them in stock for quick remediation which includes new and refurbished parts.


In the unlikely event that a whole replacement POS unit or other sealed unit such as a tablet is required (not just a spare part), then this would not be included free of charge (unless the manufacturer's warranty provides for a free new complete unit).


Note that if K3 supplied the hardware which is now more than a year old, but you do not have a hardware support contract with K3, then we may be able to help you, but it would not be governed by any SLA target times, and all time and materials would be chargeable at the standard rates.


Non-K3 Supplied Hardware

We can provide hardware support via a contract for customers who did not purchase their hardware from us. We will carry out a hardware audit before quoting and taking on support which will include recommendations, and terms bespoke for each customer.


We will not purchase spares for your own hardware, but you may purchase spares which we will hold in stock, ready for any emergency repairs.


Also See
- How Long Can Hardware be Supported For?

- Need Help, but Don't have a Hardware Support Contract?


When and How Will K3 Respond to Faults?

The following only applies to customers who have a hardware support contract in place.

Service Level Agreement

Customers with an annual hardware support contract will benefit from the target times as explained in the Standard Service Level Agreement (SLA). This SLA applies to the hardware and any faults with K3 software which you may be subscribing to. 


We will fix things remotely if possible, but if required to attend a site, we pride ourselves on usually being able to attend either the same, or next business day (depending on location and time of the fault being raised to us).


Standard Hours of coverage are weekdays (excluding UK Public Holidays) by default, but there are options to purchase weekend and Public Holiday cover as well, as explained in What days and times is Support available?


In addition, there is an option for having a Premium Service Level Agreement (SLA) - see What are the Benefits of the Premium SLA? for more information.


Support Process

We have multiple channels for you to gain access to support - see How do I contact K3 Retail Support? Once a support ticket is identified as a hardware-related issue, our first line support team will pass it to the hardware support team.


Once the hardware technician confirms that the customer and hardware is eligible for hardware support, the technician will performs an initial diagnosis of the problem through a phone call or remote session. Basic checks include:

  • POS units - Is there power to the unit? Can it reboot? Are any error messages displayed on the screen?
  • Receipt printers - Can it print a self-test with legible text?
  • Barcode scanners - Can it scan a barcode in Notepad?
  • Cash drawers - Does it open correctly?


If necessary, the technician will arrange an on-site visit at a mutually convenient time to investigate and rectify the issue. For issues which don't require a specialist engineer on site, we may ship replacement items to you and provide you with instructions and remote assistance to install them.



What’s Not Covered

Regardless of how old the hardware is, the following are not included in the hardware purchase price or support fees:

  • Deliberate or Accidental Damage - Hardware damage caused intentionally or due to mishandling or accidents. This includes cosmetic damage which is not covered.
  • Environmental Changes - Damage resulting from environmental factors such as water, heat, electrical, or other external conditions outside of our control.
  • 3rd Party Changes - Any modifications, non-approved software installations, changes to the operating system or amendments by the customer, third-party services or vendors.
  • 3rd Party Software - Any software not owned by K3 (e.g. the Windows operating system, antivirus), and updates to 3rd party software.
  • Item Relocation - Moving or relocating hardware to a different location without consulting with K3 or K3's involvement.
  • Consumables like printer toner, print heads, accessories, parts intended by the equipment manufacturer to require periodic replacement.
  • Additional Hardware – Hardware not supplied by K3, or if you are using your own hardware, if it was not in the support contract audit.
  • Data Restoration - if data is lost as a result of a hardware failure (e.g. a hard drive), we will rebuild the software, but cannot recover the software's data. If you have a backup and need help restoring it, we may be able to assist (time would be chargeable)
  • Items Beyond Economic Repair - Any hardware where the cost of the required part(s) to make the hardware properly functional will exceed the current list or new replacement price, and/or any required spare parts or components are no longer available from the manufacturer.

text: Peace of Mind for Five Years or More With an annual hardware support contract from K3, you have the peace of mind of knowing that any faults included in the agreement will be supported until the hardware is five years old. Once the hardware is more than five years old, we may still be able to offer support, but the cost of available spare parts would not be included. To provide lightening fast support, we hold spare parts for standard K3-supplied hardware, and we can also hold spare parts that customers purchase and ask us to manage for them. The availability of spare parts is one of the factors which limit the support of hardware to five years, but occasionally suppliers will end support and availability early, in which case we will advise you if spare parts are no longer available, even if your hardware is less than five years old. Recycling Hardware When equipment is surplus to requirements or at the end of its “usable” life, it can be donated or recycled. For a minimal fee, we can handle this for you. You may want to shred hard drives to be certain that data is secure which is a service we can also provide. What if You Don't have a Hardware Support Contract with K3? If you purchased the hardware from us, the manufacturer's warranty will apply - please see If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware) for more information, or see Need Help, but Don't have a Hardware Support Contract?
title: How Long Can Hardware be Supported For?
description:
Peace of Mind for Five Years or More

With an annual hardware support contract from K3, you have the peace of mind of knowing that any faults included in the agreement will be supported until the hardware is five years old. Once the hardware is more than five years old, we may still be able to offer support, but the cost of available spare parts would not be included.


To provide lightening fast support, we hold spare parts for standard K3-supplied hardware, and we can also hold spare parts that customers purchase and ask us to manage for them. The availability of spare parts is one of the factors which limit the support of hardware to five years, but occasionally suppliers will end support and availability early, in which case we will advise you if spare parts are no longer available, even if your hardware is less than five years old. 


Recycling Hardware

When equipment is surplus to requirements or at the end of its “usable” life, it can be donated or recycled. For a minimal fee, we can handle this for you. You may want to shred hard drives to be certain that data is secure which is a service we can also provide.


What if You Don't have a Hardware Support Contract with K3?

If you purchased the hardware from us, the manufacturer's warranty will apply - please see If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware) for more information, or see Need Help, but Don't have a Hardware Support Contract?

text: If you purchased hardware from us, the manufacturer's warranty will apply - please see If you do not have a K3 Hardware Support Contract (but K3 supplied the hardware). We can still help you if you don't have a hardware support contract, but it will not be governed by a Service Level Agreement (which means that response and resolution times can't be given, one-off costs will be higher, and customers with support contracts will take priority). Once we receive your request, we will create a quotation and send to you for signature. One-off support is offered on a Time and Materials (T&M) basis, and reasonable efforts will be made to resolve the issue in a timely manner. If hardware needs to be purchased or a slot booked with the technician, this will impact the resolution time. Customers will be billed for all time spent on an order/request, including any travel time, and all expenses including mileage, and any subsistence and accommodation costs. Please ask us if you would be interested in having a hardware support contract with all the benefits outlined in Hardware Support - What's Covered?
